summary: The “Expanding Access to Military Child Care Act of 2025” establishes a pilot program to expand early child care options for members of the Armed Forces and their families. The Secretary of Defense will direct the Secretaries of the military departments to create partnerships with eligible child care providers. The program aims to increase child care capacity, improve workforce development, and boost employee recruitment and retention. The bill mandates briefings, reports, and assessments, and sets a commencement date (Jan 1, 2026) and termination date (Dec 31, 2030, with possible extension).  It also requires a report on childcare needs and includes definitions for key terms.
